summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 forwarding TECS (Traveler Enforcement Compliance System) records for tracking Jeffrey Epstein's international travel. It involves coordination between a Customs and Border Protection Task Force Officer and counterparts at multiple airports to monitor Epstein's movements.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email discusses creating TECS records to track his international crossings and coordinate monitoring if he travels into specific airports.

events.title: Creation of TECS tracking records for Epstein
events.description: A Customs and Border Protection officer creates TECS records to track Jeffrey Epstein's international crossings and coordinates with counterparts for monitoring.

keyFacts: Customs and Border Protection created TECS records to track Jeffrey Epstein's international travel in July 2019.
Coordination was established between officers at JFK, Newark, and for flights into Teterboro to monitor Epstein's movements.
The email indicates active law enforcement surveillance of Epstein's travel patterns at the time.
